summary: New characters: Mitya Dmitri Fyodorovich Karamazov, Nikolai Parfenovich. New connections: Nikolay–Ippolit (friend), Dmitri–Ippolit (other), Mitya–Madame (other relationship), Dmitri–Nikolai (other).
summary_short: Introduces Mitya Dmitri Fyodorovich Karamazov and Nikolai Parfenovich. Dmitri Karamazov is the most connected figure (74 ties). Key relationship types: other, friend.
highlights: Most central: Dmitri Karamazov (74), Alyosha Karamazov (64), Fyodor Karamazov (39), Ivan Karamazov (31)
Key ties: Nikolay–Ippolit (friend), Dmitri–Ippolit (other), Mitya–Madame (other relationship), Dmitri–Nikolai (other)
story_summary: Mitya Karamazov is questioned by Nikolay Parfenovitch and the prosecutor about his actions and whereabouts, including a journey out of town and borrowing money. He recounts his jealousy over Grushenka and his intention to kill his father with a brass pestle, which he admits to picking up impulsively. Despite his frustration with the questioning, Mitya continues to tell his story, expressing feelings of being hunted and misunderstood.
evidence_quotes: I pledged them, gentlemen. I pledged them for ten roubles.
‘that I snatched up the pestle to go and kill my father ... Fyodor Pavlovitch ... by hitting him on the head with it!’
